result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felix Alexander Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Def's NOH re Review Hearing on 6/3/16 - Return to Sender.  Insufficient Address.  Unable to Forward.

Defendant Felix Alexander Hernandez and Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin not in court. No appearance by the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 1:15 pm  Def failed to appeared at previous hearing & is not here today.  CT issues warrant.  1:16 pm adj.
Review hearing on June 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:24 pm.  ADA-request warrant.  CT-warrant auth, held until 6/3 at 1 pm.  Bond cont.  1:25 pm adj.  Review hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RO-Clerk 9:45am, ADA req. warrant, CT warrant auth, stayed. bond cont. adj 9:47am  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on April 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint

Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Not to have abusive contact with:  Pedro Hernandez-Matul.  As to the 72 hr no contact order, may go with law enforcement to the residence 1 time to obtain personal belongings.

Defendant Felix Alexander Hernandez in court with attorney Dan Firkus appearing specially.  Defendant Felix Alexander Hernandez in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:49 pm.  Interpreter Sarah Tapia appears by telephone.  Firkus-unsure if qualifies.  1:51 pm-recess.  2:03 pm-back on the record.  Firkus-qualifes for PD, but will be appt'd out.  CT sets bond.  As to 72 hr no contact order, may go with law enforcement to the residence 1 time to obtain personal belongings.  JA to schedule w/ counsel at PD office, possibly atty Perrin.  2:17 pm adj.
